RT @avsa: ENS is a complex system made of multiple contracts (I found 16 so far). This ensures we can freeze some parts and update others,‚Ä¶

@adamhunt__ @Jamie_ethnft @wallamolla @matthewegould @unstoppableweb @ensdomains If you can't reliably read the words of a wiki I cannot expect you to read my own, but I'll give it a try because some people need it

Ethiopia is in possession of the .eth extension - ccTLDs require countries a maximum of 2 characters making .eth unused but officially registered

@Jamie_ethnft @adamhunt__ @wallamolla @matthewegould @unstoppableweb @ensdomains https://t.co/LpS5ChCxz4

Here you go

@adamhunt__ @wallamolla @Jamie_ethnft @matthewegould @unstoppableweb @ensdomains To my knowledge the leading development team has not only been in negotiations with ICANN in regards of potentially securing the .eth TLD but have also positioned themselves beautifully into actually acquiring it as Ethiopia is not capable of utilizing it

@adamhunt__ @wallamolla @Jamie_ethnft @matthewegould @unstoppableweb @ensdomains Because ENS limits itself to .eth TLDs and .eth is currently not being utilized by the country in which it is reserved (the TLD of countries are required to be 2 characters in length & .eth is 3) making ENS the most likely naming service to actually integrate directly with DNS
RT @Brommhill: @Jamie_ethnft @matthewegould @unstoppableweb @ensdomains "I actually think it's a good thing that all of the premium .com na‚Ä¶

@Jamie_ethnft @matthewegould @unstoppableweb @ensdomains "I actually think it's a good thing that all of the premium .com names were taken in the 90s never to be utilized again"

That's the argument of UD supporters who think domains shouldn't expire btw

@Jamie_ethnft @matthewegould @unstoppableweb @ensdomains In case you needed some more clarification, they directly mention a "DECENTRALIZED IDENTITY STANDARD" - not a centralized static-NFT issuing company with better marketing

@Jamie_ethnft @matthewegould @unstoppableweb @ensdomains https://t.co/2LAZbNcyWs

Any more questions?

@Jamie_ethnft @matthewegould @unstoppableweb @ensdomains Sure, but they haven't acknowledged UD as the decentralized identity standard to my knowledge the way in which they did ENS

Have you seen any large UD sales lately the way ENS has had recently? Maybe if you want to spend $100k for a "premium" name directly from their website lol

@Jamie_ethnft @matthewegould @unstoppableweb @ensdomains Coinbase & Chainlink being the primary two, yes

Checkout all of the subdomains that data.eth has issued it's a pretty fun rabbit hole to go down

@Jamie_ethnft @matthewegould @unstoppableweb @ensdomains Right, you can break that down a lot easier by saying UD is a centralized NFT issuer with no long-term sustainability other than new names (all premiums lost forever) and ENS is an actual decentralized naming protocol

You're right, they function differently

@Jamie_ethnft @matthewegould @unstoppableweb @ensdomains Brantly is gone from the non-profit company leading the development of ENS, not ENS itself

Distinctions are pretty important!

@Jamie_ethnft @matthewegould @unstoppableweb @ensdomains Because of this you are able to receive funds from virtually any and all blockchains as you can simply update those text-records to match whatever public address you would like to share

Did you know that ENS has a feature being released shortly called CCIP-read? Do some reading

@Jamie_ethnft @matthewegould @unstoppableweb @ensdomains Because it's done in a decentralized way and this requires fees

For the sustainability and longevity of this decentralized naming ecosystem requires fees and a working name economy e.g. expiries

You own UD outright - but it's just another NFT

ENS is the naming standard of web3

@Jamie_ethnft @matthewegould @unstoppableweb @ensdomains Nope, of course leasing something under that lens is never better than outright ownership

But it's different with ENS; it is outright ownership - there is nobody in the world that can take your domains from you if you participate in the @ensdomains economy and pay your fees

@ptonerdoteth I would love to hear your thoughts on how you would achieve long-term sustainability for a decentralized naming protocol in which names do not expire
@cerecrypto @zerozerocoins And this is still more fair than rewarding those who bot, interface with the contract directly, and pay premium gas fees to expedite their claim
